alert.note: Alert for City of Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 9:08PM EST until January 11 at 11:12AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast North Carolina, including the following counties, Gates and Northampton and southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent cities, City of Franklin, City of Suffolk, Greensville, Isle of Wight, Southampton, Surry and Sussex. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 908 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Franklin, Smithfield, Windsor, Courtland, Wakefield, Boykins, Surry, Holland, Downtown Suffolk, Chesapeake, Suffolk, Isle Of Wight, Sussex, Ivor, Newsoms, Dendron, Sedley, Zuni, Hunterdale and Carrsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
